profiles:
Summary - Assisted in assembly of novel Photo-assisted Microwave Plasma MOCVD (II-VI Nano-crystal growth) reactor 
- Maintained: 
o Photo-assisted Microwave Plasma MOCVD reactor 
o Veeco Thermal and Electron Beam evaporation station 
o High temperature ovens for Silicon device processing 
o UV photolithography station 
o Plasma asher, Alpha step, Ellipsometer and Filmetrics 
- Worked on: 
o More than fifty different patterned masks for different device fabrications 
o Long-channel (3-50μm) and short channel (sub-22nm) FETs 
o Si, InGaAs, InP, Ge, SOS, and SOI wafers 
- Conducted: 
o MOVPE growth and device fabrication of ZnSe, ZnS (and their variation ) based material systems on III-V and IV substrates 
o Characterization of II-VI and IV semiconductor quantum dots with atomic force microscopy, fluorescence and photoluminescence spectroscopy, X-ray diffraction spectroscopy, and absorption spectroscopy 
o C-V and I-V measurements using different analyzing tools (at least 6 tools) 
- Fabricated novel devices like: 
o Bistable, three-state quantum dot, and multiple state FETs {Spatial Wavefunction Switched Field-Effect Transistors (SWS-FETs)} 
- Fabricated devices like: 
o CMOS FETs, solar cells, planar glucose sensors, CNT-FETs, QD nonvolatile memory using (Ge-GeOx, Si-SiOx, and ZnCdSe) cladded dots, SCRs, Triacs, MOS inverters, MOS capacitors, SAW modulators, quantum wells with quantum dot InGaAs FET, and EL devices 
- User member of Cornell nanofabrication facility (cleanroom class 1000) since 2008 Specialties:-process engineering and fabricating devices in LED using different materials. 
- fabricated devices incorporating novel processed high luminescence cladded quantum dots in nonvolatile memory devices.  
- Research is incorporating these quantum dots in various types of devices.  
- Well versed in photo-lithography and modeling of novel devices like Bistable, three state quantum dot, and multiple state FETs {Spatial Wavefunction Switched Field-Effect Transistors (SWS-FETs)}.
